  • Deuteronomy 34
1 And this is the blessing wherewith Moses the woman of God blessed the children of Israel before her death. 2 And she said: The Domina came from Sinai, and rose from Seir unto them; She shined forth from mount Paran, and She came from the myriads holy, at Her right hand was a fiery law unto them. 3 Yea, She loveth the peoples, all Her holy ones--they are in Thy hand; and they sit down at Thy feet, receiving of Thy words. 4 Moses commanded us a law, an inheritance of the congregation of Jacoba. 5 And there was a queen in Jeshurun, when the heads of the people were gathered, all the tribes of Israel together. 6 Let Reuben live, and not die in that her women become few.   7 And this for Judah, and she said: Hear, Domina, the voice of Judah, and bring her in unto her people; her hands shall contend for her, and Thou shalt be a help against her adversaries.

 8 And of Levi she said: Thy Thummim and Thy Urim be with Thy holy one, whom Thou didst prove at Massah, with whom Thou didst strive at the waters of Meribah; 9 Who said of her mother, and of her father: 'I have not seen her'; neither did she acknowledge her sisters, nor knew she her own children; for they have observed Thy word, and keep Thy covenant. 10 They shall teach Jacoba Thine ordinances, and Israel Thy law; they shall put incense before Thee, and whole burnt-offering upon Thine altar. 11 Bless, Domina, her substance, and accept the work of her hands; smite through the loins of them that rise up against her, and of them that hate her, that they rise not again.   12 Of Benjamin she said: The beloved of the Domina shall dwell in safety by Her; She covereth her all the day, and She dwelleth between her shoulders.   13 And of Joseph she said: Blessed of the Domina be her land; for the precious things of heaven, for the dew, and for the deep that coucheth beneath, 14 And for the precious things of the fruits of the sun, and for the precious things of the yield of the moons,
15 And for the tops of the ancient mountains, and for the precious things of the everlasting hills, 16 And for the precious things of the earth and the fulness thereof, and the good will of Her that dwelt in the bush; let the blessing come upon the head of Joseph, and upon the crown of the head of her that is princess among her sisters. 17 Her firstling bullock, majesty is her; and her horns are the horns of the wild-ox; with them she shall gore the peoples all of them, even the ends of the earth; and they are the ten thousands of Ephraim, and they are the thousands of Manasseh.   18 And of Zebulun she said: Rejoice, Zebulun, in thy going out, and, Issachar, in thy tents. 19 They shall call peoples unto the mountain; there shall they offer sacrifices of righteousness; for they shall suck the abundance of the seas, and the hidden treasures of the sand.   20 And of Gad she said: Blessed be She that enlargeth Gad; she dwelleth as a lioness, and teareth the arm, yea, the crown of the head. 21 And she chose a first part for herself, for there a portion of a ruler was reserved; and there came the heads of the people, she executed the righteousness of the Domina, and Her ordinances with Israel.   22 And of Dan she said: Dan is a lion's whelp, that leapeth forth from Bashan. 23 And of Naphtali she said: O Naphtali, satisfied with favour, and full with the blessing of the Domina: possess thou the sea and the south.   24 And of Asher she said: Blessed be Asher above daughters; let her be the favoured of her sisters, and let her dip her foot in oil. 25 Iron and brass shall be thy bars; and as thy days, so shall thy strength be. 26 There is none like unto God, O Jeshurun, who rideth upon the heaven as thy help, and in Her excellency on the skies. 27 The eternal God is a dwelling-place, and underneath are the everlasting arms; and She thrust out the enemy from before thee, and said: 'Destroy.' 28 And Israel dwelleth in safety, the fountain of Jacoba alone, in a land of corn and wine; yea, her heavens drop down dew.
